News Flash

  1. Shred Day - Saturday, April 20, 2019

    The next shred day will be held at the Service Dept. on Saturday, April 20 from 9:00 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. Residents wishing to participate may drop off items during this time, where they will be shred on site. No need to remove staples or clips.

  2. Solar Power for Homes and Businesses

    The Cuyahoga County Department of Sustainability is hosting an informational meeting for residents interested in solar power for homes and businesses. Read on...

  3. Commission on Aging Senior Activities

    Join the Highland Hts. Commission on Aging for our upcoming events! Read on...

  4. Computer Round Up Collection Program

    The first computer round up collection program for the year is going on now! From now through April 30, residents wishing to participate in the program can drop off items at the Service Dept. between 8:00 a.m. and 3:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. Read on...

  5. SimpleRecycling Comes to Highland Heights

    Beginning April 1, 2019, curbside pickup of unwanted textiles and small household items for recycling will be available to Highland Hts. residents. Read on...

  6. Cuyahoga County Board of Health Notification

    Recently, residents in our area have noticed some raccoons acting strangely. In response to these concerns, our police department was able to locate suspected raccoons which were sent to CCBH for testing. Read on...

  7. Summer Program Registration-Baseball, Softball and T-Ball

    Registration is now open for 2019 Summer Baseball, Softball and T-Ball programs. Read on...
